verses.kjv: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
verses.ct: At this point, the 3 men stopped responding to Job, because he considered himself to be in the right.

verses.kjv: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
verses.ct: Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, from the family of Ram, became furious. He was angry at Job because Job claimed he was right rather than God.

verses.kjv: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
verses.ct: He was also angry at Job's 3 friends because they had failed to come up with a real answer, yet they still treated Job as guilty.

verses.kjv: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.
verses.ct: Now Elihu had held back while Job was speaking, because the others were older than him.

verses.kjv: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
verses.ct: But when Elihu realized that these 3 men had nothing left to say, his anger boiled over.

verses.kjv: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.
verses.ct: So Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite spoke up and said, "I'm young, and you are all much older than me. That's why I held back and didn't dare share my thoughts with you.

verses.kjv: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
verses.ct: I thought, 'Age should have its say, and many years of living should produce wisdom.'

verses.kjv: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
verses.ct: But it is the spirit within a person, the breath of the Almighty, that gives someone understanding.

verses.kjv: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.
verses.ct: It's not always the prominent who are wise, and growing old doesn't guarantee good judgment.

verses.kjv: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.
verses.ct: So I'm asking you — listen to me. Let me share what I think.

verses.kjv: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.
verses.ct: Look, I waited patiently for your words. I listened carefully to your arguments while you searched for the right things to say.

verses.kjv: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:
verses.ct: Yes, I paid close attention to you, and yet not one of you proved Job wrong or successfully answered what he said.

verses.kjv: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.
verses.ct: Don't go claiming, 'We've discovered true wisdom — only God can refute him, not any human.'

verses.kjv: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.
verses.ct: Job hasn't directed his arguments at me, and I won't respond to him using your same lines of reasoning.

verses.kjv: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.
verses.ct: They are stunned into silence. They have nothing more to say. Words have completely failed them.

verses.kjv: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)
verses.ct: Should I keep waiting just because they've gone quiet, standing there with no further response?

verses.kjv: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.
verses.ct: No — I will give my own answer. I will share what I think.

verses.kjv: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.
verses.ct: I am bursting with things to say; the spirit inside me is pressing me to speak.

verses.kjv: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
verses.ct: My insides are like a sealed bottle of fermenting wine, ready to explode like new wineskins about to split open.

verses.kjv: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.
verses.ct: I need to speak so I can find relief. I have to open my mouth and respond.

verses.kjv: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man’s person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
verses.ct: I won't show favoritism to anyone, and I won't use flattery on any person.

verses.kjv: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
verses.ct: I don't even know how to flatter — if I did, my Maker would quickly put an end to me."
